channel.title: Post and servers that work on mac
channel.description: if you know of a server that works on mac please post here or pm me thank you and please do it i have been looking for one for a long time now thanks

make it mac compatible yourself. in the sinklink just change the c:/ to user.home

signlink

There isn’t a reason for it not to work with apple java, so long as it’s not the newer client versions.
[/quote]ah sorry my keyboard is all sticky at the moment :S[/quote]

I giggled at this. Does that make me immature?

item.source: Post and servers that work on mac

item.title: Post and servers that work on mac
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

mattrocks98:

i connect to the default one 127.0.0.1 idk thats what i was told to put but i dont have a client or anything no one makes zip download links so i cant even test most servers to see if they work

That’s your problem right there, 127.0.0.1 is your local computer’s IP address, if there is no server running on your computer then it’s going to return “error connecting to server”.

Read full topic
item.source: Post and servers that work on mac

item.title: Post and servers that work on mac
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

mattrocks98:

ether the client doesnt open at all or if it does it never opens

That makes complete sense…

What kind of IPs are you connecting to? And specifically which clients are you using? Some servers only allow their client to connect to their server.

Read full topic
item.source: Post and servers that work on mac

item.dc:creator: @mattrocks98 mattrocks98
item.description:

well ether the client doesnt open at all or if it does it never opens and webclient most dont work they ether go white or error connecting to the server

item.title: Post and servers that work on mac
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

mattrocks98:

what are you all talking about?

What happens when you try to connect to a server? Does the client applet even load up? Are you even using a webclient? What client are you using? So many questions :o

Read full topic
